newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Majority of Colombians see country in crisis - poll.
newsitem.headline: Majority of Colombians see country in crisis - poll.

text.p: A full 90 percent of Colombians believe their country is in a state of crisis, according to a survey published on Saturday in Bogota's El Tiempo newspaper.

The poll, involving 7,450 participants in top cities nationwide, was commissioned by the ruling Liberal Party and carried out between June 9 and July 2 by Global Strategy Group Inc. of the United States. Its margin of error was 1.1 percent.

No comparative figures were given for the survey, but political analysts said it was believed to mark the first time such an overwhelming majority of Colombians described their country as in a state of crisis. Only six percent of participants said they thought the country was in something less than critical condition.
Unemployment was identified as the leading cause of Colombia's problems by 36 percent of those polled, while 25 percent said lawlessness and corruption were the top problems facing the country.
Only 19 percent pointed to leftist guerrilla groups as the top problem confronting Colombians.
